metadata.title: CVE-2023-46343 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.5.9, there is a NULL pointer dereference insend_acknowledge in net/nfc/nci/spi.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-100-generic - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-5.15.0-100-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-generic - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-generic-64k - 5.15.0-100.110
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-25-generic - 6.5.0-25.25~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-25-generic - 6.5.0-25.25~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-100.110').
